intro: Pseudodictamnus africanus, commonly known as African dictamnus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Rutaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The genus Pseudodictamnus is closely related to Dictamnus, but differs in its leaf structure and flowering patterns.
